column1: In the judicial decision of Martin Singho Vs. Queen 69 CLW 21, it was held:

column3: “Even  if  the  jury  declined  to  believe  the  appellant’s  version,  he  was  yet
entitled to be acquitted on the charge if his version raised in their mind a
reasonable doubt as to the truth of the prosecution case.”
